translation.ja: ピタは誘拐先でもテレビを見たり―

translation.en: And she'd eat ice cream.
translation.ja: アイスも もらえる

translation.en: And we'd have her back in two days. He lied to me!
translation.ja: ２日で戻るとジョーダンはウソを！

translation.en: That's why he's fucking dead. I did it!
I did it, Lisa!
I agreed to the kidnapping.
I did it for us. For the three of us.
translation.ja: 僕ら家族のために３人のために

translation.en: I'm so sorry, Lisa.
You kill him.
You kill him, or I will.
You know how they say a...
bullet always tells the truth.
It never lies.
It didn't work for me, Samuel,
but maybe...
maybe it'll work for you.
I'll pray for you.
This is definitely the address from the ATM card.
translation.ja: <銀行カードの示す住所です>

translation.en: The PIN number was a great locator.
But there's no one that sounds anything like The Voice.
Who's that?
He's the man,
The Voice.
My guys got into the house...
on the pretext of giving cholera shots.
translation.ja: <コレラの予防接種と言って>

translation.en: We had to inject the whole barrio.
We bugged the house and stole the picture of him.
translation.ja: 〈カメラを仕掛け　奴の写真を頂いた〉

translation.en: Now it's time to pursue him.
We have to put his photo in tomorrow's newspaper.
If you value your life,
you won't publish those photos.
- Mr. Creasy? - Yeah, it's me.
translation.ja: クリーシー？ そうだ

translation.en: I traced the PIN for you and I have an address.
The cardholder is Reina Rosas Sanchez, the wife of "The Voice."
translation.ja: カードの持ち主は“ボイス”の妻のレイナ

translation.en: She lives in Los Arcos, apartment 26D, via Appia.
translation.ja: 住所はロス･アルコス通りアパート26Ｄ

translation.en: - Good. - And another thing.
In today's paper is a picture of The Voice. "FEAR HAS A VOICE."
translation.ja: 新聞に“ボイス”の写真が

translation.en: Good. Thank you.
He's in.
What do we do?
Nothing... Nothing.
Out of my house, you son of a bitch!
Stop there!
Get out. The kids out. Now!
Sit down.
Sit down!
Reina Rosas, yes?
Who is this? Who is this?
- Daniel. - Daniel what?
Daniel Rosas Sanchez.
The Voice?
And this is his brother?
What is his name?
What is his name?
Aurelio.
Aurelio Rosas Sanchez, okay.
Okay.
And you are Daniel's woman, right?
How do you contact him?
How do you contact him?
We page him,
and he calls back on his cellphone.
Call him.
There's no signal in here.
We have to go on the roof.
Let's go outside.
Outside.
They're going to get a call.
Be ready to track him.
If we're lucky he'll lead us to The Voice.
translation.ja: <運がよければ居所が分かる>

translation.en: Hola, Daniel.
- Señor Creasy. - Yeah.
translation.ja: <クリーシーか> ああ お前の家族を預かってる

translation.en: Yeah, I got your family here.
translation.ja: ああ お前の家族を預かってる

translation.en: Your brother doesn't look too good.
Yeah, Reina, she's what, about eight months? Yeah?
You wanna negotiate?
The most important thing in life is family. Do you agree?
translation.ja: 人生で最も大事なのは― 家族だ　そうだろ？

translation.en: I agree.
There you are, you have my family.
Well, most of my family.
translation.ja: お前に捕らえられてる

translation.en: My wife and I are separated. You know how that is.
translation.ja: おれたち夫婦は別居中だしな

translation.en: Now, tell me seriously, how much do you want?
translation.ja: 正直な話いくら欲しいんだ？

translation.en: Your brother wants to speak to you. Here, hold on.
What the hell do you want?
Listen to me! Listen!
I'll take your family apart piece by piece. You understand me?
translation.ja: 家族の体をバラバラにしてやる

translation.en: Piece by piece! Shut up!
I don't want your money.
You understand me? You understand me?
translation.ja: 分かるか おれの望みは お前だ

translation.en: I'm listening.
I'm listening, Daniel. I'm listening.
translation.ja: 聞いてるぞ 聞いてる

translation.en: All right. I will give you a life for a life.
translation.ja: よし 命と命を交換しよう

translation.en: Whose life? What are you talking about?
Whose life, Daniel? I want you!
I will give you her life. For your life.
translation.ja: 彼女の命とお前の命を交換だ

translation.en: And in exchange, I will get my life back.
translation.ja: 引き換えに― おれの命は助かる

translation.en: - What life? Whose life? - The girl's. Pita's.
translation.ja: “彼女”とは誰だ？ あの子さ ピタだ

translation.en: - Pita's dead! - Creasy!
I'm a businessman. A girl dead is worth nothing.
translation.ja: おれは商売人だ 商品を殺しちゃ何にもならない

translation.en: She's alive.
translation.ja: 商品を殺しちゃ何にもならない

translation.en: All right.
I want proof of life, you hear me? I want proof of life. I want...
translation.ja: 証拠を見せろ 証拠になるもの…

translation.en: I want the name of her bear. What does she call her bear?
translation.ja: ぬいぐるみのクマの名だ

translation.en: You tell her to tell you to tell me what she calls her bear.
translation.ja: ピタに聞け クマを何て呼んでるか

translation.en: Little one...
What do you call your teddy bear?
Creasy. She calls the bear Creasy Bear.
translation.ja: “クリーシー”だ クマの名は― クリーシーだ

translation.en: Remember...
I will give you her life
translation.ja: 彼女の命と引き換えに―

translation.en: for your life
and the life of my brother.
Okay.
Okay.
I give you your brother, you give me the girl.
- All right. - Where?
He left the roof. We lost the signal.
We got cut off.
We lost him. We lost him.
Damn.
- Hello? - Lisa, listen to me. Don't hang up.
I think Pita's alive.
I can't take this anymore.
Take the road to Puebla. Get off junction 34, south side.
translation.ja: プエブラへの道を― 34番で降りろ

translation.en: I'll meet you there in two hours.
So where is she?
She's right over there. You see those two cars out there?
Pita's kidnapper, Daniel...
Here's his brother.
I'm going up on the bridge to get Pita.
translation.ja: おれがピタを迎えにいく何か起きたら―

translation.en: Anything goes wrong, you put it to his head,
translation.ja: おれがピタを迎えにいく何か起きたら― こいつを撃て

translation.en: you pull the trigger, all right?
You understand?
You don't let him loose
translation.ja: 決して― こいつを放すな

translation.en: until she's with you, you got it?
And you don't wait for me, okay?
- Yeah. - You'll be all right. You okay?
Creasy!
Creasy!
- You all right? - Yeah.
They didn't hurt you?
Hi.
All right, your mother's waiting for you. She's at the end the bridge.
translation.ja: ママが待ってる橋を降りた所だ

translation.en: - Okay, you go home. - Okay.
- All right. - Where are you going?
I'm going home too.
I'm going to Blue Bayou.
I got something for you.
I got the last number too.
I love you, Creasy.
And you love me, don't you?
Yes, I do.
Now, come on, Pita, go.
- Go. Run. - Bye.
Pita!
- Mom! - Baby, come here! It's okay!
- Mom! - Come on.
Okay, I'll let you go now.
